summary: The Medicare Dental, Hearing, and Vision Expansion Act of 2025 aims to amend Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide Medicare coverage for dental, hearing, and vision care. The bill defines covered services, establishes payment methods (including fee schedules and limits), and addresses related issues such as rural health clinics, practitioner qualifications, and the phase-in of premium impacts. Coverage for hearing aids and eyeglasses is also included, along with rules for implementation. The bill appropriates funds for implementation.
